00022 /* The timer calculations of this module informed by the 'RepRap cartesian firmware' by Zack Smith
00023    and Philipp Tiefenbacher. */
00024 
00025 #include "stepper.h"
00026 #include "config.h"
00027 #include "settings.h"
00028 #include <math.h>
00029 #include <stdlib.h>
00030 #include <util/delay.h>
00031 #include "nuts_bolts.h"
00032 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00033 #include "planner.h"
00034 
00035 // Some useful constants
00036 #define TICKS_PER_MICROSECOND (F_CPU/1000000)
00037 #define CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK ((TICKS_PER_MICROSECOND*1000000)/ACCELERATION_TICKS_PER_SECOND)
00038 
00039 // Stepper state variable. Contains running data and trapezoid variables.
00040 typedef struct {
00041   // Used by the bresenham line algorithm
00042   int32_t counter_x,        // Counter variables for the bresenham line tracer
00043           counter_y,
00044           counter_z,
00045          counter_t;
00046   uint32_t event_count;
00047   uint32_t step_events_completed;  // The number of step events left in current motion
00048 
00049   // Used by the trapezoid generator
00050   uint32_t cycles_per_step_event;        // The number of machine cycles between each step event
00051   uint32_t trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter; // The cycles since last trapezoid_tick. Used to generate ticks at a steady
00052                                               // pace without allocating a separate timer
00053   uint32_t trapezoid_adjusted_rate;      // The current rate of step_events according to the trapezoid generator
00054   uint32_t min_safe_rate;  // Minimum safe rate for full deceleration rate reduction step. Otherwise halves step_rate.
00055 } stepper_t;
00056 
00057 static stepper_t st;
00058 static block_t *current_block;  // A pointer to the block currently being traced
00059 
00060 // Used by the stepper driver interrupt
00061 static uint8_t step_pulse_time; // Step pulse reset time after step rise
00062 static uint8_t out_bits;        // The next stepping-bits to be output
00063 static volatile uint8_t busy;   // True when SIG_OUTPUT_COMPARE1A is being serviced. Used to avoid retriggering that handler.
00064 
00065 #if STEP_PULSE_DELAY > 0
00066   static uint8_t step_bits;  // Stores out_bits output to complete the step pulse delay
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 //         __________________________
00070 //        /|                        |\     _________________         ^
00071 //       / |                        | \   /|               |\        |
00072 //      /  |                        |  \ / |               | \       s
00073 //     /   |                        |   |  |               |  \      p
00074 //    /    |                        |   |  |               |   \     e
00075 //   +-----+------------------------+---+--+---------------+----+    e
00076 //   |               BLOCK 1            |      BLOCK 2          |    d
00077 //
00078 //                           time ----->
00079 //
00080 //  The trapezoid is the shape the speed curve over time. It starts at block->initial_rate, accelerates by block->rate_delta
00081 //  during the first block->accelerate_until step_events_completed, then keeps going at constant speed until
00082 //  step_events_completed reaches block->decelerate_after after which it decelerates until the trapezoid generator is reset.
00083 //  The slope of acceleration is always +/- block->rate_delta and is applied at a constant rate following the midpoint rule
00084 //  by the trapezoid generator, which is called ACCELERATION_TICKS_PER_SECOND times per second.
00085 
00086 static void set_step_events_per_minute(uint32_t steps_per_minute);
00087 
00088 void st_enable() {
00089    STEPPERS_DISABLE_PORT = (STEPPERS_DISABLE_PORT & ~(1<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT)) |
00090     (STEPPERS_DISABLE_INVERT<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT);
00091 }
00092 
00093 void st_disable() {
00094    STEPPERS_DISABLE_PORT = (STEPPERS_DISABLE_PORT & ~(1<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT)) |
00095     ((1<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT) ^ (STEPPERS_DISABLE_INVERT<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT));
00096 }
00097 
00098 int st_is_enabled() {
00099   return !((STEPPERS_DISABLE_DDR & (1<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT)) &&
00100     ((STEPPERS_DISABLE_PORT & (1<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT)) ^ (STEPPERS_DISABLE_INVERT<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT)));
00101 }
00102 
00103 // Stepper state initialization
00104 static void st_wake_up()
00105 {
00106   // Initialize stepper output bits
00107   out_bits = (0) ^ (settings.invert_mask_stepdir);
00108   // Initialize step pulse timing from settings. Here to ensure updating after re-writing.
00109   #ifdef STEP_PULSE_DELAY
00110     // Set total step pulse time after direction pin set. Ad hoc computation from oscilloscope.
00111     step_pulse_time = -(((settings.pulse_microseconds+STEP_PULSE_DELAY-2)*TICKS_PER_MICROSECOND) >> 3);
00112     // Set delay between direction pin write and step command.
00113     OCR2A = -(((settings.pulse_microseconds)*TICKS_PER_MICROSECOND) >> 3);
00114   #else // Normal operation
00115     // Set step pulse time. Ad hoc computation from oscilloscope. Uses two's complement.
00116     step_pulse_time = -(((settings.pulse_microseconds-2)*TICKS_PER_MICROSECOND) >> 3);
00117   #endif
00118   st_enable();
00119   // Enable stepper driver interrupt
00120   TIMSK1 |= (1<<OCIE1A);
00121 }
00122 
00123 // Stepper shutdown
00124 void st_go_idle()
00125 {
00126   // Disable stepper driver interrupt
00127   TIMSK1 &= ~(1<<OCIE1A);
00128   // Force stepper dwell to lock axes for a defined amount of time to ensure the axes come to a complete
00129   // stop and not drift from residual inertial forces at the end of the last movement.
00130   #ifdef STEPPER_IDLE_LOCK_TIME
00131     _delay_ms(STEPPER_IDLE_LOCK_TIME);
00132   #endif
00133 }
00134 
00135 // This function determines an acceleration velocity change every CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK by
00136 // keeping track of the number of elapsed cycles during a de/ac-celeration. The code assumes that
00137 // step_events occur significantly more often than the acceleration velocity iterations.
00138 inline static uint8_t iterate_trapezoid_cycle_counter()
00139 {
00140   st.trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter += st.cycles_per_step_event;
00141   if(st.trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter > CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK) {
00142     st.trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter -= CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK;
00143     return(true);
00144   }
00145   else {
00146     return(false);
00147   }
00148 }
00149 
00150 // "The Stepper Driver Interrupt" - This timer interrupt is the workhorse of Grbl. It is executed at the rate set with
00151 // config_step_timer. It pops blocks from the block_buffer and executes them by pulsing the stepper pins appropriately.
00152 // It is supported by The Stepper Port Reset Interrupt which it uses to reset the stepper port after each pulse.
00153 // The bresenham line tracer algorithm controls all three stepper outputs simultaneously with these two interrupts.
00154 ISR(TIMER1_COMPA_vect)
00155 {
00156   if (busy) { return; } // The busy-flag is used to avoid reentering this interrupt
00157 
00158   // Set the direction pins a couple of nanoseconds before we step the steppers
00159   STEPPING_PORT = (STEPPING_PORT & ~DIRECTION_MASK) | (out_bits & DIRECTION_MASK);
00160   // Then pulse the stepping pins
00161   #ifdef STEP_PULSE_DELAY
00162     step_bits = (STEPPING_PORT & ~STEP_MASK) | out_bits; // Store out_bits to prevent overwriting.
00163   #else  // Normal operation
00164     STEPPING_PORT = (STEPPING_PORT & ~STEP_MASK) | out_bits;
00165   #endif
00166   // Enable step pulse reset timer so that The Stepper Port Reset Interrupt can reset the signal after
00167   // exactly settings.pulse_microseconds microseconds, independent of the main Timer1 prescaler.
00168   TCNT2 = step_pulse_time; // Reload timer counter
00169   TCCR2B = (1<<CS21); // Begin timer2. Full speed, 1/8 prescaler
00170 
00171   busy = true;
00172   // Re-enable interrupts to allow ISR_TIMER2_OVERFLOW to trigger on-time and allow serial communications
00173   // regardless of time in this handler. The following code prepares the stepper driver for the next
00174   // step interrupt compare and will always finish before returning to the main program.
00175   sei();
00176 
00177   // If there is no current block, attempt to pop one from the buffer
00178   if (current_block == NULL) {
00179     // Anything in the buffer? If so, initialize next motion.
00180     current_block = plan_get_current_block();
00181     if (current_block != NULL) {
00182    if (!sys.feed_hold) {
00183   // During feed hold, do not update rate and trap counter. Keep decelerating.
00184   st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate = current_block->initial_rate;
00185   set_step_events_per_minute(st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate); // Initialize cycles_per_step_event
00186   st.trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter = CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK/2; // Start halfway for midpoint rule.
00187    }
00188    st.min_safe_rate = current_block->rate_delta + (current_block->rate_delta >> 1); // 1.5 x rate_delta
00189    st.counter_x = -(current_block->step_event_count >> 1);
00190    st.counter_y = st.counter_x;
00191    st.counter_z = st.counter_x;
00192    st.counter_t = st.counter_x;
00193    st.event_count = current_block->step_event_count;
00194    st.step_events_completed = 0;
00195     }
00196     else {
00197   st_go_idle();
00198   sys.cycle_start = false;
00199   bit_true(sys.execute,EXEC_CYCLE_STOP); // Flag main program for cycle end
00200     }
00201   }
00202 
00203   if (current_block != NULL) {
00204     // Execute step displacement profile by bresenham line algorithm
00205     out_bits = current_block->direction_bits;
00206     st.counter_x += current_block->steps_x;
00207     if (st.counter_x > 0) {
00208       out_bits |= (1<<X_STEP_BIT);
00209       st.counter_x -= st.event_count;
00210       if (out_bits & (1<<X_DIRECTION_BIT)) { sys.position[X_AXIS]--; }
00211       else { sys.position[X_AXIS]++; }
00212     }
00213     st.counter_y += current_block->steps_y;
00214     if (st.counter_y > 0) {
00215       out_bits |= (1<<Y_STEP_BIT);
00216       st.counter_y -= st.event_count;
00217       if (out_bits & (1<<Y_DIRECTION_BIT)) { sys.position[Y_AXIS]--; }
00218       else { sys.position[Y_AXIS]++; }
00219     }
00220     st.counter_z += current_block->steps_z;
00221     if (st.counter_z > 0) {
00222       out_bits |= (1<<Z_STEP_BIT);
00223       st.counter_z -= st.event_count;
00224       if (out_bits & (1<<Z_DIRECTION_BIT)) { sys.position[Z_AXIS]--; }
00225       else { sys.position[Z_AXIS]++; }
00226     }
00227 /// 844 : axis T
00228     st.counter_t += current_block->steps_t;
00229  if (st.counter_t > 0) {
00230       out_bits |= (1<<T_STEP_BIT);
00231       st.counter_t -= st.event_count;
00232       if (out_bits & (1<<T_DIRECTION_BIT)) {
00233   sys.position[T_AXIS]--;
00234       }
00235       else {
00236   sys.position[T_AXIS]++;
00237    }
00238     }
00239 /// <--
00240 
00241     st.step_events_completed++; // Iterate step events
00242 
00243     // While in block steps, check for de/ac-celeration events and execute them accordingly.
00244 
00245 /// LETARTARE 20/04/2014 : comparison between signed and unsigned integer expressions
00246 /// step_events_completed (uint32_t), step_event_count (int32_t)
00247     if (st.step_events_completed < current_block->step_event_count) {
00248       if (sys.feed_hold) {
00249         // Check for and execute feed hold by enforcing a steady deceleration from the moment of
00250         // execution. The rate of deceleration is limited by rate_delta and will never decelerate
00251         // faster or slower than in normal operation. If the distance required for the feed hold
00252         // deceleration spans more than one block, the initial rate of the following blocks are not
00253         // updated and deceleration is continued according to their corresponding rate_delta.
00254         // NOTE: The trapezoid tick cycle counter is not updated intentionally. This ensures that
00255         // the deceleration is smooth regardless of where the feed hold is initiated and if the
00256         // deceleration distance spans multiple blocks.
00257         if ( iterate_trapezoid_cycle_counter() ) {
00258           // If deceleration complete, set system flags and shutdown steppers.
00259 /// LETARTARE 20/04/2014 : comparison between signed and unsigned integer expressions
00260           if (st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate <= current_block->rate_delta) {
00261             // Just go idle. Do not NULL current block. The bresenham algorithm variables must
00262             // remain intact to ensure the stepper path is exactly the same. Feed hold is still
00263             // active and is released after the buffer has been reinitialized.
00264             st_go_idle();
00265             sys.cycle_start = false;
00266             bit_true(sys.execute,EXEC_CYCLE_STOP); // Flag main program that feed hold is complete.
00267           }
00268           else {
00269             st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate -= current_block->rate_delta;
00270             set_step_events_per_minute(st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate);
00271           }
00272         }
00273       }
00274       else {
00275         // The trapezoid generator always checks step event location to ensure de/ac-celerations are
00276         // executed and terminated at exactly the right time. This helps prevent over/under-shooting
00277         // the target position and speed.
00278         // NOTE: By increasing the ACCELERATION_TICKS_PER_SECOND in config.h, the resolution of the
00279         // discrete velocity changes increase and accuracy can increase as well to a point. Numerical
00280         // round-off errors can effect this, if set too high. This is important to note if a user has
00281         // very high acceleration and/or feedrate requirements for their machine.
00282         if (st.step_events_completed < current_block->accelerate_until) {
00283           // Iterate cycle counter and check if speeds need to be increased.
00284           if ( iterate_trapezoid_cycle_counter() ) {
00285             st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate += current_block->rate_delta;
00286             if (st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate >= current_block->nominal_rate) {
00287               // Reached nominal rate a little early. Cruise at nominal rate until decelerate_after.
00288               st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate = current_block->nominal_rate;
00289             }
00290             set_step_events_per_minute(st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate);
00291           }
00292         }
00293         else
00294   if (st.step_events_completed >= current_block->decelerate_after) {
00295           // Reset trapezoid tick cycle counter to make sure that the deceleration is performed the
00296           // same every time. Reset to CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK/2 to follow the midpoint rule for
00297           // an accurate approximation of the deceleration curve.
00298           if (st.step_events_completed == current_block-> decelerate_after) {
00299             st.trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter = CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK/2;
00300           }
00301     else {
00302             // Iterate cycle counter and check if speeds need to be reduced.
00303             if ( iterate_trapezoid_cycle_counter() ) {
00304               // NOTE: We will only do a full speed reduction if the result is more than the minimum safe
00305               // rate, initialized in trapezoid reset as 1.5 x rate_delta. Otherwise, reduce the speed by
00306               // half increments until finished. The half increments are guaranteed not to exceed the
00307               // CNC acceleration limits, because they will never be greater than rate_delta. This catches
00308               // small errors that might leave steps hanging after the last trapezoid tick or a very slow
00309               // step rate at the end of a full stop deceleration in certain situations. The half rate
00310               // reductions should only be called once or twice per block and create a nice smooth
00311               // end deceleration.
00312               if (st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate > st.min_safe_rate) {
00313                 st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate -= current_block->rate_delta;
00314               }
00315               else {
00316                 st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate >>= 1; // Bit shift divide by 2
00317               }
00318               if (st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate < current_block->final_rate) {
00319                 // Reached final rate a little early. Cruise to end of block at final rate.
00320                 st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate = current_block->final_rate;
00321               }
00322               set_step_events_per_minute(st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate);
00323             }
00324           }
00325         }
00326         else {
00327           // No accelerations. Make sure we cruise exactly at the nominal rate.
00328           if (st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate != current_block->nominal_rate) {
00329             st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate = current_block->nominal_rate;
00330             set_step_events_per_minute(st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate);
00331           }
00332         }
00333       }
00334     }
00335     else {
00336       // If current block is finished, reset pointer
00337       current_block = NULL;
00338       plan_discard_current_block();
00339     }
00340   }
00341   out_bits ^= settings.invert_mask_stepdir;  // Apply stepper invert mask
00342   busy = false;
00343 }
00344 
00345 // This interrupt is set up by ISR_TIMER1_COMPAREA when it sets the motor port bits. It resets
00346 // the motor port after a short period (settings.pulse_microseconds) completing one step cycle.
00347 // TODO: It is possible for the serial interrupts to delay this interrupt by a few microseconds, if
00348 // they execute right before this interrupt. Not a big deal, but could use some TLC at some point.
00349 ISR(TIMER2_OVF_vect)
00350 {
00351   // Reset stepping pins (leave the direction pins)
00352   STEPPING_PORT = (STEPPING_PORT & ~STEP_MASK) | (settings.invert_mask_stepdir & STEP_MASK);
00353   TCCR2B = 0; // Disable Timer2 to prevent re-entering this interrupt when it's not needed.
00354 }
00355 
00356 #ifdef STEP_PULSE_DELAY
00357   // This interrupt is used only when STEP_PULSE_DELAY is enabled. Here, the step pulse is
00358   // initiated after the STEP_PULSE_DELAY time period has elapsed. The ISR TIMER2_OVF interrupt
00359   // will then trigger after the appropriate settings.pulse_microseconds, as in normal operation.
00360   // The new timing between direction, step pulse, and step complete events are setup in the
00361   // st_wake_up() routine.
00362   ISR(TIMER2_COMPA_vect)
00363   {
00364     STEPPING_PORT = step_bits; // Begin step pulse.
00365   }
00366 #endif
00367 
00368 // Reset and clear stepper subsystem variables
00369 void st_reset()
00370 {
00371   memset(&st, 0, sizeof(st));
00372   set_step_events_per_minute(MINIMUM_STEPS_PER_MINUTE);
00373   current_block = NULL;
00374   busy = false;
00375 }
00376 
00377 // Initialize and start the stepper motor subsystem
00378 void st_init()
00379 {
00380   // Configure directions of interface pins
00381   STEPPING_DDR |= STEPPING_MASK;
00382   STEPPING_PORT = (STEPPING_PORT & ~STEPPING_MASK) | settings.invert_mask_stepdir;
00383   STEPPERS_DISABLE_DDR |= 1<<STEPPERS_DISABLE_BIT;
00384 
00385   // Disable the stepper drivers
00386   st_disable();
00387 
00388   // waveform generation = 0100 = CTC
00389   TCCR1B &= ~(1<<WGM13);
00390   TCCR1B |=  (1<<WGM12);
00391   TCCR1A &= ~(1<<WGM11);
00392   TCCR1A &= ~(1<<WGM10);
00393 
00394   // output mode = 00 (disconnected)
00395   TCCR1A &= ~(3<<COM1A0);
00396   TCCR1A &= ~(3<<COM1B0);
00397 
00398   // Configure Timer 2
00399   TCCR2A = 0; // Normal operation
00400   TCCR2B = 0; // Disable timer until needed.
00401   TIMSK2 |= (1<<TOIE2);
00402 
00403   #ifdef STEP_PULSE_DELAY
00404     TIMSK2 |= (1<<OCIE2A); // Enable Timer2 Compare Match A interrupt
00405   #endif
00406 
00407   // Start in the idle state
00408   st_go_idle();
00409 }
00410 
00411 // Configures the prescaler and ceiling of timer 1 to produce the given rate as accurately as possible.
00412 // Returns the actual number of cycles per interrupt
00413 static uint32_t config_step_timer(uint32_t cycles)
00414 {
00415   uint16_t ceiling;
00416   uint8_t prescaler;
00417   uint32_t actual_cycles;
00418   if (cycles <= 0xffffL) {
00419     ceiling = cycles;
00420     prescaler = 1; // prescaler: 0
00421     actual_cycles = ceiling;
00422   }
00423   else
00424   if (cycles <= 0x7ffffL) {
00425     ceiling = cycles >> 3;
00426     prescaler = 2; // prescaler: 8
00427     actual_cycles = ceiling * 8L;
00428   }
00429   else
00430   if (cycles <= 0x3fffffL) {
00431     ceiling =  cycles >> 6;
00432     prescaler = 3; // prescaler: 64
00433     actual_cycles = ceiling * 64L;
00434   }
00435   else
00436   if (cycles <= 0xffffffL) {
00437     ceiling =  (cycles >> 8);
00438     prescaler = 4; // prescaler: 256
00439     actual_cycles = ceiling * 256L;
00440   }
00441   else
00442   if (cycles <= 0x3ffffffL) {
00443     ceiling = (cycles >> 10);
00444     prescaler = 5; // prescaler: 1024
00445     actual_cycles = ceiling * 1024L;
00446   }
00447   else {
00448     // Okay, that was slower than we actually go. Just set the slowest speed
00449     ceiling = 0xffff;
00450     prescaler = 5;
00451     actual_cycles = 0xffff * 1024;
00452   }
00453   // Set prescaler
00454   TCCR1B = (TCCR1B & ~(0x07<<CS10)) | (prescaler<<CS10);
00455   // Set ceiling
00456   OCR1A = ceiling;
00457   return(actual_cycles);
00458 }
00459 
00460 static void set_step_events_per_minute(uint32_t steps_per_minute)
00461 {
00462   if (steps_per_minute < MINIMUM_STEPS_PER_MINUTE) {
00463  steps_per_minute = MINIMUM_STEPS_PER_MINUTE;
00464   }
00465   st.cycles_per_step_event = config_step_timer((TICKS_PER_MICROSECOND*1000000*60)/steps_per_minute);
00466 }
00467 
00468 // Planner external interface to start stepper interrupt and execute the blocks in queue. Called
00469 // by the main program functions: planner auto-start and run-time command execution.
00470 void st_cycle_start()
00471 {
00472   if (!sys.cycle_start) {
00473     if (!sys.feed_hold) {
00474       sys.cycle_start = true;
00475       st_wake_up();
00476     }
00477   }
00478 }
00479 
00480 // Execute a feed hold with deceleration, only during cycle. Called by main program.
00481 void st_feed_hold()
00482 {
00483   if (!sys.feed_hold) {
00484     if (sys.cycle_start) {
00485       sys.auto_start = false; // Disable planner auto start upon feed hold.
00486       sys.feed_hold = true;
00487     }
00488   }
00489 }
00490 
00491 // Reinitializes the cycle plan and stepper system after a feed hold for a resume. Called by
00492 // runtime command execution in the main program, ensuring that the planner re-plans safely.
00493 // NOTE: Bresenham algorithm variables are still maintained through both the planner and stepper
00494 // cycle reinitializations. The stepper path should continue exactly as if nothing has happened.
00495 // Only the planner de/ac-celerations profiles and stepper rates have been updated.
00496 void st_cycle_reinitialize()
00497 {
00498   if (current_block != NULL) {
00499     // Replan buffer from the feed hold stop location.
00500     plan_cycle_reinitialize(current_block->step_event_count - st.step_events_completed);
00501     // Update initial rate and timers after feed hold.
00502     st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate = 0; // Resumes from rest
00503     set_step_events_per_minute(st.trapezoid_adjusted_rate);
00504     st.trapezoid_tick_cycle_counter = CYCLES_PER_ACCELERATION_TICK/2; // Start halfway for midpoint rule.
00505     st.step_events_completed = 0;
00506   }
00507   sys.feed_hold = false; // Release feed hold. Cycle is ready to re-start.
00508 }
